title: Public opinion and UK issues in 1997

content.question: Which of the following statements is supported by the data in the table above?

choices.label: Respondents were more likely to support devolution than to oppose it.
Respondents preferred to keep the first-past-the-post electoral system.
Respondents supported the idea of a written constitution but not a bill of rights.
Two-thirds of the respondents opposed the proposal for locally elected mayors.
A majority of respondents supported the proposal to remove the constitutional powers of the monarchy.

content.answer: Respondents were more likely to support devolution than to oppose it.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
